intro: Tetratheca pilata, commonly known as the silky tetratheca, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Theaceae and is characterized by its small, white or pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub with slender, hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are clustered in umbels and are often visited by insects such as bees and butterflies. Tetratheca pilata is adapted to grow in sandy or rocky soils and is often found in coastal regions.
